page.title: 16FAMILY LIFE IN TODDINGTON
page.content: For this survey 200 questionnaires on {Home Life}were examined. Most families are British, and members of the Church of England. Most have two{Children}and keep household pets; some children over 16 having full-time education. Most families have lived in Toddington for less than twenty years.{Houses}are mostly owned, most popular being three bedroomed with gas central heating and having a medium sized garden. Most own one car and have a garage. Most homes have a television, refrigerator and telephone - washing machines fewer in number. Main meal of the day eaten at home in the evening. Cooking done by gas or electricity. Very small number of fathers unemployed.{Leisure}time is spent mainly watching TV or gardening. Holidays are spent mostly in hotels in this country. Shopping done at Luton, Flitwick and Milton Keynes.
